parameters.name: response_format
parameters.description:
The format in which the configuration object is to be fetched. This could be for example
 - in GetSpec form for the contents of object
 - in CreateRequest form to create a new similar object
 - to ReplaceRequest form to replace changeable values

Default format of returned resource
Response should be in CreateRequest format
Response should be in ReplaceRequest format
Response should be in StatusObject(s) format
Response should be in format of GetSpecType
Response should have other objects referring to this object
Response should have deleted and disabled objects referrred by this object.

pdf.description: Base 64 encoded invoice as a PDF document.
pdf.title: PDF

invoiceInvoiceStatus.description:
Invoice status

Unknown, undefined status
Invoice is just issued
Invoice is pending, also known as running invoice
Invoice is paid
Invoice is refunded
Cancelled invoice (before being due)
Set when current date is past due date, clears when the invoice gets paid.
invoiceInvoiceStatus.title: Invoice status.

active.description: Indicate whether an invoice is active or not. Active invoices are not finalised and their value can change. Inactive invoices are final and their value cannot change.
active.title: Invoice active flag.

invoices.description: List of invoices as per customer request.
invoices.title: Invoices

contactContactType.description:
Determines the contact type

Indicates snail mail address (used for correspondence)
Indicates billing address (this address will appear on invoices)
Indicates contact used for a payment method (this address is used when charging a payment method)
contactContactType.title: Contact Type.

contactGlobalSpecType.description:
Instance of one single contact that can be used to communicate with customers.
Depending on contact type we use these details to send general communication (regular, physical mail) or invoices.
contactGlobalSpecType.title: Contact

payment_methodCreatePaymentMethodRequest.description: This is the input message of the 'Create' RPC.
payment_methodCreatePaymentMethodRequest.title: CreateRequest is used to create an instance of payment_method.

namespace.description:
This namespace specifies the namespace in which the payment method will be created.
If not provided, the default 'system' namespace will be used.
namespace.title: Namespace

token.description: Token associated with this payment method. This token needs to be obtained from a designated payment method provider e.g. Stripe.
token.title: Token

name.description: Name of the newly created payment method object.
name.title: Name

payment_methodPaymentMethodPrimaryReq.description: Changes a payment method role to primary.
payment_methodPaymentMethodPrimaryReq.title: Change payment method role request.

name.description: The name of the payment method object to be made primary.
name.title: Name

namespace.description: The namespace in which the payment method object is present.
namespace.title: Namespace

payment_methodPaymentMethodRole.description:
Defines if a payment method is used as a primary or backup source of fund.

Unknown payment method role
Primary payment method role. Always used when attempting to charge for F5 Distributed Cloud's services.
Secondary payment method role. Used when primary payment method failed.
Normal payment method is a card that has no role as such.
payment_methodPaymentMethodRole.title: Payment method role.

payment_methodPaymentMethodRoleSwapReq.description: Changes a payment method role (from/to primary or backup)
payment_methodPaymentMethodRoleSwapReq.title: Change payment method role request.

name.description: The name of the payment method object to be updated.
name.title: Name

namespace.description: The namespace in which the payment method object is present.
namespace.title: Namespace

payment_methodPaymentMethodSecondaryReq.description: Changes a payment method role to secondary.
payment_methodPaymentMethodSecondaryReq.title: Change payment method role request.

name.description: The name of the payment method object to be made secondary.
name.title: Name

namespace.description: The namespace in which the payment method object is present.
namespace.title: Namespace

plan_transitionGetPlanTransitionRsp.description: Request body of GetPlanTransition custom API.
plan_transitionGetPlanTransitionRsp.title: GetPlanTransitionRsp.

plan_transitionInitiatePlanTransitionReq.description: Request body of InitiatePlanTransition custom API.
plan_transitionInitiatePlanTransitionReq.title: InitiatePlanTransitionReq.

namespace.description: This namespace is not used, all requests are stored under system namespace.
namespace.title: Namespace

new_plan.description: New plan template name tenant want to move to.
new_plan.title: New plan

plan_transitionInitiatePlanTransitionRsp.description: Response body of InitiatePlanTransition custom API.
plan_transitionInitiatePlanTransitionRsp.title: InitiatePlanTransitionRsp.

id.description: ID of the newly created plan transition request.
id.title: ID

requires_manual_approval.description: Flag to specify whether the request requires manual approval.
requires_manual_approval.title: Requires_manual_approval.

plan_transitionState.description:
State of the plan transition FSM

- STATE_UNSPECIFIED: Zero value for this state. Should be considered as an invalid state. User has to always explicitly
specify which other state should be.
- STATE_CREATING: Initial state after plan transition object creation.
- STATE_FAILED: Some step(-s) failed during plan transition execution.
- STATE_FINISHED: All steps were successfully done during plan transition execution.
- STATE_WAITING_FOR_APPROVAL: Request is awaiting for manual approval by SRE.
plan_transitionState.title: State

plan_transitionTransitionPayload.description: Payload which is required to execute transition from the current tenant's plan to a given new_plan.
plan_transitionTransitionPayload.title: TransitionPayload.

billing_provider_account_id.description:
ID of the billing provider account created to verify the billing info provided with this object.
The ID is then used to ensure no more duplicate billing account is created.
Note: this is set by the backend during the creation of plan_transition object. Anything passed from UI will be ignored.
billing_provider_account_id.title: Billing_provider_account_id.

create_support_ticket.description: If set to true, a support ticket will be created to provide the plan transition request.
create_support_ticket.title: Create_support_ticket.

deletion_feedback.description: Feedback from the customer related to reason of account deletion.
deletion_feedback.title: Feedback

payment_provider_token.description: Payment provider token (for credit card details)
payment_provider_token.title: Payment_provider_token.

subscribe_addon_services.description: List of addon services that needs to be subscribed/enabled part of this plan transition.
subscribe_addon_services.title: Subscribe_addon_services.

support_ticket_info.description: Additional information user want to record part of the support ticket.
support_ticket_info.title: Support_ticket_info.

tp_subscription_id.description:
ID of the third party subscription ID created.
Note: this is set by the backend as part of the notifiers run as the plan_transition object is created.
tp_subscription_id.title: Tp_subscription_id.

unsubscribe_addon_services.description: List of addon services that needs to be unsubscribed/removed part of this plan transition.
unsubscribe_addon_services.title: Unsubscribe_addon_services.

schemacontactGlobalSpecType.description:
Instance of one single contact that can be used to communicate with customers.
Depending on contact type we use these details to send general communication (regular, physical mail) or invoices.
schemacontactGlobalSpecType.title: Contact

tenantDeletionReason.description:
List of available reason for account deletion.

- REASON_UNKNOWN: Unknown reason

Unknown reason
- REASON_SWITCH_TO_FREE_PLAN: Switch to free plan

Switch to free plan
- REASON_NO_LONGER_NEEDED: No longer needed

No longer needed
- REASON_NOT_JUSTIFY_COSTS: Too expensive

Too expensive
- REASON_DIFFICULT_TO_USE: Difficult to use

Difficult to use.
tenantDeletionReason.title: DeletionReason.

type_url.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `HTTP`, `HTTPS`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `HTTPS` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.type][]
value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `HTTP`, `HTTPS` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

quotaDeleteRequest.description: This is the input message of the 'DELETE' RPC.

fail_if_referred.title: Fail_if_referred.

X-displayName: "Limit (float)"
FloatLimitType defines a float quota value that should not be exceeded. Useful for items that have
quotas in fractions.

resources.title: Resources

quotaGetResponse.description: This is the output message of the 'GET' RPC.
quotaGetResponse.title: GetResponse is the shape of a read quota.

deleted_referred_objects.description: The set of deleted objects that are referred by this object.
deleted_referred_objects.title: Deleted_referred_objects.

disabled_referred_objects.description: The set of deleted objects that are referred by this object.
disabled_referred_objects.title: Disabled_referred_objects.

referring_objects.description: The set of objects that are referring to this object in their spec.
referring_objects.title: Referring_objects.

status.description: The status reported by different services for this configuration object.
status.title: Status

quotaGetResponseFormatCode.description:
X-displayName: "GET Response Format"
This is the various forms that can be requested to be sent in the GetResponse

- GET_RSP_FORMAT_DEFAULT: x-displayName: "Default Format"
Default format of returned resource
- GET_RSP_FORMAT_FOR_CREATE: x-displayName: "Create request Format"
Response should be in CreateRequest format
- GET_RSP_FORMAT_FOR_REPLACE: x-displayName: "Replace request format"
Response should be in ReplaceRequest format
- GET_RSP_FORMAT_STATUS: x-displayName: "Status format"
Response should be in StatusObject(s) format
- GET_RSP_FORMAT_READ: x-displayName: "GetSpecType format"
Response should be in format of GetSpecType
- GET_RSP_FORMAT_REFERRING_OBJECTS: x-displayName: "Referring Objects"
Response should have other objects referring to this object
- GET_RSP_FORMAT_BROKEN_REFERENCES: x-displayName: "Broken Referred Objects"
Response should have deleted and disabled objects referrred by this object.
quotaGetResponseFormatCode.title: GetResponseFormatCode.

quotaGetResponseType.description:
User": {limit: {maximum: 10}, usage: {number: 8}}, "virtual_host":{limit: {maximum: 12}, usage: {number: 6}}, "domain": {limit: {maximum: 7}, usage: {number: 5}}}"
Map of quotas that are assigned for the current tenant and namespace.
quotaGetResponseType.title: GET response.

objects.description: Configured limits for object instances and current usage.
objects.title: Objects

resources.description: Configured limits for resources and current usage if relevant.
resources.title: Resources

quotaLimitType.description:
X-displayName: "Limit"
LimitType defines a quota value for a specific object kind that should not be exceeded.
quotaLimitType.title: LimitType

maximum.description:
X-displayName: "Maximum"
The maximum value for the object kind.
maximum.title: Maximum

conditions.description: Conditions reported by various component of the system.
conditions.title: Conditions.

object_refs.description: Reference to object for current status.
object_refs.title: Object_refs.

schemaConditionType.description:
Conditions are used in the object status to describe the current state of the
object, e.g. Ready, Succeeded, etc.
schemaConditionType.title: ConditionType.

hostname.description: Hostname of the instance of the site that sent the status.
hostname.title: Hostname

last_update_time.description: Last time the condition was updated.
last_update_time.title: Last_update_time.

reason.description:
X-reason: "Insufficient memory in data plane"
A human readable string explaining the reason for reaching this condition.
reason.title: Reason

service_name.description: Name of the service that sent the status.
service_name.title: Service name.

status.description:
Status of the condition
"Success" Validtion has succeded. Requested operation was successful.
"Failed" Validation has failed.
"Incomplete" Validation of configuration has failed due to missing configuration.
"Installed" Validation has passed and configuration has been installed in data path or K8s
"Down" Configuration is operationally down. E.g. Down interface
"Disabled" Configuration is administratively disabled i.e. objectmetatype.disable = true.
"NotApplicable" Configuration is not applicable e.g. Tenant service_policy_set(s) in system namespace are not applicable on REs.
status.title: Status

type.description:
Type of the condition
"Validation" represents validation user given configuration object
"Operational" represents operational status of a given configuration object.
type.title: Type

schemaErrorCode.description:
Union of all possible error-codes from system

- EOK: No error
- EPERMS: Permissions error
- EBADINPUT: Input is not correct
- ENOTFOUND: Not found
- EEXISTS: Already exists
- EUNKNOWN: Unknown/catchall error
- ESERIALIZE: Error in serializing/de-serializing
- EINTERNAL: Server error
- EPARTIAL: Partial error.
schemaErrorCode.title: ErrorCode

schemaErrorType.description: Information about a error in API operation.
schemaErrorType.title: ErrorType

message.description: A human readable string of the error.
message.title: Message

schemaInitializerType.description: Initializer is information about an initializer that has not yet completed.
schemaInitializerType.title: InitializerType.

name.description: Name of the service that is responsible for initializing this object.
name.title: Name

schemaInitializersType.description: Initializers tracks the progress of initialization of a configuration object.
schemaInitializersType.title: InitializersType.

pending.description:
Pending is a list of initializers that must execute in order before this object is initialized.
When the last pending initializer is removed, and no failing result is set, the initializers
struct will be set to nil and the object is considered as initialized and visible to all
clients.
pending.title: Pending

schemaObjectCreateMetaType.description: ObjectCreateMetaType is metadata that can be specified in Create request of an object.
schemaObjectCreateMetaType.title: ObjectCreateMetaType.

annotations.description:
Annotations is an unstructured key value map stored with a resource that may be
set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata. They are not
queryable and should be preserved when modifying objects.
annotations.title: Annotations.

description.description: Human readable description for the object.
description.title: Description.

disable.description: A value of true will administratively disable the object.
disable.title: Disable

labels.description:
Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize
(scope and select) objects as chosen by the user. Values specified here will be used
by selector expression.
labels.title: Labels

name.description:
This is the name of configuration object. It has to be unique within the namespace.
It can only be specified during create API and cannot be changed during replace API.
The value of name has to follow DNS-1035 format.
Required: YES.
name.title: Name

namespace.description:
This defines the workspace within which each the configuration object is to be created.
Must be a DNS_LABEL format. For a namespace object itself, namespace value will be ""
namespace.title: Namespace

Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize

name.description:
This is the name of configuration object. It has to be unique within the namespace.
It can only be specified during create API and cannot be changed during replace API.
The value of name has to follow DNS-1035 format.
Required: YES.
name.title: Name

namespace.description:
This defines the workspace within which each the configuration object is to be created.
Must be a DNS_LABEL format. For a namespace object itself, namespace value will be ""
namespace.title: Namespace

schemaObjectRefType.description:
This type establishes a 'direct reference' from one object(the referrer) to another(the referred).
Such a reference is in form of tenant/namespace/name for public API and Uid for private API
This type of reference is called direct because the relation is explicit and concrete (as opposed
to selector reference which builds a group based on labels of selectee objects)
schemaObjectRefType.title: ObjectRefType.

kind.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. Virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
then kind will hold the referred object's kind (e.g. "route")
kind.title: Kind

name.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. Virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
then name will hold the referred object's(e.g. Route's) name.
name.title: Name

namespace.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. Virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
then namespace will hold the referred object's(e.g. Route's) namespace.
namespace.title: Namespace

tenant.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. Virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
then tenant will hold the referred object's(e.g. Route's) tenant.
tenant.title: Tenant

uid.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. Virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
then uid will hold the referred object's(e.g. Route's) uid.
uid.title: Uid

queryable and should be preserved when modifying objects.

labels.title: Labels

name.description:

It can only be specified during create API and cannot be changed during replace API.

Required: YES.

Must be a DNS_LABEL format. For a namespace object itself, namespace value will be ""

schemaStatusMetaType.description: StatusMetaType is metadata that all status must have.
schemaStatusMetaType.title: StatusMetaType.

creation_timestamp.description:
Creation_timestamp is when the status object was created. It is used to find/tie-break
for latest status object from same origin.
creation_timestamp.title: Creation_timestamp.

creator_class.description:
Class of creator which created this StatusObject. This will be service's DNS FQDN.
This will be set by the system based on client certificate information.
creator_class.title: Creator_class.

creator_id.description:
ID of creator which created this StatusObject. This will be a concrete identifier for service (e.g.
Identifying the environment also). This will be set by the system based on client certificate
information.
creator_id.title: Creator_id.

status_id.description:
Status_id is a field used by the generator to distinguish (if necessary) between two status
objects for the same config object from the same site and same service and potentially same
daemon(creator-ID)
status_id.title: Status_id

uid.description: Uid is the unique in time and space value for a StatusObject.
uid.title: Uid

vtrp_id.description: Origin of this status exchanged by VTRP.
vtrp_id.title: Vtrp_id

vtrp_stale.description: Indicate whether mars deems this object to be stale via graceful restart timer information.
vtrp_stale.title: Vtrp_stale.

schemaStatusPublishType.description:
StatusPublishType is all possible publish operations on a StatusObject

- STATUS_DO_NOT_PUBLISH: Do Not Publish

Do not propagate this status to user. This could be because status is only informational
- STATUS_PUBLISH: Publish

Propagate this status up to user as it might be actionable.
schemaStatusPublishType.title: StatusPublishType.

schemaStatusType.description: Status is a return value for calls that don't return other objects.
schemaStatusType.title: StatusType.

code.description: Suggested HTTP return code for this status, 0 if not set.
code.title: Code

reason.description:
A human-readable description of why this operation is in the
"Failure" status. If this value is empty there
is no information available.
reason.title: Reason

status.description:
Status of the operation.
One of: "Success" or "Failure".
status.title: Status

schemaSystemObjectGetMetaType.description:
SystemObjectGetMetaType is metadata generated or populated by the system for all persisted objects and
cannot be updated directly by users.
schemaSystemObjectGetMetaType.title: SystemObjectGetMetaType.

creation_timestamp.description:
CreationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was
created. It is not guaranteed to be set in happens-before order across separate operations.
Clients may not set this value. It is represented in RFC3339 form and is in UTC.
creation_timestamp.title: Creation_timestamp.

creator_class.description: A value identifying the class of the user or service which created this configuration object.
creator_class.title: Creator_class.

creator_id.description: A value identifying the exact user or service that created this configuration object.
creator_id.title: Creator_id.

deletion_timestamp.description:
DeletionTimestamp is RFC 3339 date and time at which this resource will be deleted. This
field is set by the server when a graceful deletion is requested by the user, and is not
directly settable by a client. The resource is expected to be deleted (no longer visible
from resource lists, and not reachable by name) after the time in this field, once the
finalizers list is empty. As long as the finalizers list contains items, deletion is blocked.
Once the deletionTimestamp is set, this value may not be unset or be set further into the
future, although it may be shortened or the resource may be deleted prior to this time.
For example, a user may request that a pod is deleted in 30 seconds. The Kubelet will react
by sending a graceful termination signal to the containers in the pod. After that 30 seconds,
the Kubelet will send a hard termination signal (SIGKILL) to the container and after cleanup,
remove the pod from the API. In the presence of network partitions, this object may still
exist after this timestamp, until an administrator or automated process can determine the
resource is fully terminated.
If not set, graceful deletion of the object has not been requested.

Populated by the system when a graceful deletion is requested.
Read-only.
deletion_timestamp.title: Deletion_timestamp.

finalizers.description:
Must be empty before the object is deleted from the registry. Each entry
is an identifier for the responsible component that will remove the entry
from the list. If the deletionTimestamp of the object is non-nil, entries
in this list can only be removed.
finalizers.title: Finalizers.

labels.description:
Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize
(scope and select) objects as chosen by the operator or software. Values here can be interpreted
by software(backend or frontend) to enable certain behavior e.g. Things marked as soft-deleted(restorable).
labels.title: Labels

modification_timestamp.description:
ModificationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was
last modified.
modification_timestamp.title: Modification_timestamp.

object_index.description:
Unique index for the object. Some objects need a unique integer index to be allocated
for each object type. This field will be populated for all objects that need it and will
be zero otherwise.
object_index.title: Object_index.

tenant.description:
Tenant to which this configuration object belongs to. The value for this is found from
presented credentials.
tenant.title: Tenant

uid.description:
Uid is the unique in time and space value for this object. It is generated by
the server on successful creation of an object and is not allowed to change on Replace
API. The value of is taken from uid field of ObjectMetaType, if provided.
uid.title: Uid

schemaViewRefType.description: ViewRefType represents a reference to a view.
schemaViewRefType.title: ViewRefType.

name.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. Virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
then name will hold the referred object's(e.g. Route's) name.
name.title: Name

namespace.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. Virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
then namespace will hold the referred object's(e.g. Route's) namespace.
namespace.title: Namespace

schemaquotaCreateSpecType.description: Create quota creates a given object from storage backend for metadata.namespace.
schemaquotaCreateSpecType.title: Create quota.

api_limits.description:
API Limits defines ratelimit parameters for an API at the stdlib service
The key of the api_limits map is rpc FQN e.g. "VES.I/o.schema.advertise_policy.api.create"

object_limits.description:
Object Limits define maximum number of instances that can be present per object kind for the tenant
The key of the object_limits map is object kind e.g. "virtual_host"

resource_limits.description:
Resource Limits define maximum value of resources in the appropriate units that can be present. The key of
the resource limits is the resource name.

schemaquotaGetSpecType.description: GET quota reads a given object from storage backend for metadata.namespace.
schemaquotaGetSpecType.title: GET quota

api_limits.description:
API Limits defines ratelimit parameters for an API at the stdlib service
The key of the api_limits map is rpc FQN e.g. "VES.I/o.schema.advertise_policy.api.create"

object_limits.description:
Object Limits define maximum number of instances that can be present per object kind for the tenant
The key of the object_limits map is object kind e.g. "virtual_host"

resource_limits.description:
Resource Limits define maximum value of resources in the appropriate units that can be present. The key of
the resource limits is the resource name.

schemaquotaReplaceSpecType.description: Replace quota updates a given object from storage backend for metadata.namespace.
schemaquotaReplaceSpecType.title: Replace quota.

api_limits.description:
API Limits defines ratelimit parameters for an API at the stdlib service
The key of the api_limits map is rpc FQN e.g. "VES.I/o.schema.advertise_policy.api.create"

object_limits.description:
Object Limits define maximum number of instances that can be present per object kind for the tenant
The key of the object_limits map is object kind e.g. "virtual_host"

resource_limits.description:
Resource Limits define maximum value of resources in the appropriate units that can be present. The key of
the resource limits is the resource name.

usageFloatUsageType.description:
X-displayName: "Usage (float)"
FloatUsageType defines the usage in float. Useful to report usage for items that have limits in
fractions.

usageUsageType.description:
X-displayName: "Usage"
UsageType defines the number of objects of a specific object kind that are currently in use.

current.description:
X-displayName: "Current"
The in-use value for the object kind.
current.title: Current

subscriptionPeriod.description: Response to call to GET list of tenant subscriptions.

end_date.description: Kast day of the last billing_period in external provider.
end_date.title: End date

internal_end_date.description: Internal end date that serves as source of truth.
internal_end_date.title: Internal end date.

internal_start_date.description: Internal start date that serves as source of truth.
internal_start_date.title: Internal start date.

invoices.description: Link to all of the invoices for this period.
invoices.title: Invoices

start_date.description: The first day of the last billing_period in external provider.
start_date.title: Start date.

trial.description: Flag shows if this billing time frame is part of trial period.

uid.description: Unique identifier of this time frame.
uid.title: UUID

subscriptionSubscriptionType.description: Tenant subscription to the services record.

current.description: Flag shows if this subscription is currently active.

last_billing_period_end_date.description: The last day of the last billing_period.

last_billing_period_start_date.description: The first day of the last billing_period.

name.description: Name of the subscription (internal name, not human readable), a subscription has no human readable name.
name.title: Name

previous_billing_periods.description: List of the previous billing periods.
previous_billing_periods.title: Previous billing periods.

schemausageStatusType.description:
All possible usage line statuses

- STATUS_UNKNOWN: No value defined
- STATUS_NO_DATA: No data
- STATUS_NOT_MEASURED: No measured
- STATUS_ACTIVE: Active.
schemausageStatusType.title: Status type.

usageCalculatedUsageItem.description: One line of usage, including pricing details.
usageCalculatedUsageItem.title: CalculatedUsageItem.

fixed.description: Means that this data came not from usage (reserved flag for support/discount/onboarding fees)
fixed.title: Fixed

metric_labels.description: ID of the corresponding aggregated_usage metric labels from which this calculated usage item is assembled.
metric_labels.title: Metric labels.

quantity_billable.description:
Quantity which is used to calculate the amount. Rounded from quantity as the following:
* after converting quantity from unit_code to unit_code of this addon_id, if the value < 1, then
quantity_billable is rounded to 1
* after converting quantity from unit_code to unit_code of this addon_id, if the value > 1, then
quantity_billable is rounded down to the nearest value.
quantity_billable.title: Quantity billable.

unit_name_billable.description: Unit name a quantity_billable is provided in.
unit_name_billable.title: Unit name billable.

usage_type.title: Usage type.
usage_type.x-ves-example: ADN App Mgmt - Customer Edge Large Containers.

usageCoupon.description: Coupon details, discount type, amount and name.
usageCoupon.title: Coupon

discount_amount.description:
[x-required]
If discount_type is fixed_amount, discount_amount is in cents
If discount_type is percentage, discount_amount is in percentages of 0.01% precision (12.35% equals to 1235)
discount_amount.title: Discount amount.

usageDiscountType.description:
Indicates what type of discount is applied for a coupon: fixed price or percentage.

Unknown
The specified amount will be given as discount.
The specified percentage will be given as discount.
usageDiscountType.title: Discount type.

usageHourlyItem.description: One line of usage by an hour. One hour as the least resolution.

container.description: Container name if this item correspond to the container usage. Otherwise it's empty.

deployment.description:

deployment.title: Deployment.

usageUsageItem.description: Usage item represents a line in a usage report, including quantity and resource incurring usage.

An array of HourlyItem with usage per hour. The sum of these items will result into the parent's object `quantity`
Deprecated: use /hourly_usage_details along with hourly_breakdown_query.
hourly_breakdown.title: Hourly breakdown.

[x-required]
A base64 encoded JSON which should be passed as is to /hourly_usage_details
to GET hourly items for this aggregated usage.

ID of the usage type. As Usage type is shown for user and is a subject of frequent changes,
this metric_label should be static and should be usage for mapping between calculated usage and aggregated_usage.
metric_label.title: Metric label.

planListUsagePlansRsp.title: Usage Plans Response.

locale.description: Locale in the ISO dashed format.
locale.title: Locale

plans.description: Collection of currently publicly available plans.
plans.title: Plans

planPeriodUnitType.description:
Temporal period type

- PERIOD_UNKNOWN: unknown, undefined period of time
- PERIOD_DAY: Day
- PERIOD_WEEK: Week
- PERIOD_MONTH: Month
- PERIOD_YEAR: Year.
planPeriodUnitType.title: Period type.

planPlanInternal.description: Structure that holds all data needed to choose usage plan.
planPlanInternal.title: PlanInternal.

allowed_addon_services.description: List of addon services that can be subscribed part of current plan.

billing_disabled.description: If true then there's no automatic billing.
billing_disabled.title: Billing disabled.

current.description: True if plan is active. Note that customers are only allowed to current plans.
current.title: Current

description.description: Description of the plan as mark-down text.
description.title: Description.
description.x-ves-example: ###Free plan, includes x y z *Free item 1 *Free item 2 ##Self-support only.

flat_price.description: Flat fee of the plan in cents.
flat_price.title: Flat price.

included_addon_services.description: List of addon services that are available part of current plan.

name.description: Name of the plan, the name is not guaranteed to be human readable.
name.title: Name

subtitle.description: Optional second line of the title of the plan, human readable.
subtitle.title: Sub-Title

title.description: Title of the plan, human readable.
title.title: Title

trial_period.description: Trial period associated with this plan. Different pricing conditions are in place during the trial period - flat fee my not apply, or similar.
trial_period.title: Trial period.

planPlanState.description:
State of the

- STATE_UNSPECIFIED: zero value
- STATE_READY: the plan is in default state
- STATE_TRANSITION_PENDING: the plan is in the state of plan transitioning. If the plan has current flag equals to true and in
TRANSITION_PENDING then tenant moves to another plan which is in state TRANSITION_PENDING.
At the same moment in time no more than 2 plans should have TRANSITION_PENDING state.
planPlanState.title: PlanTransitionState.

planPlanTransitionMethod.description:
Transitioning method which UI should show to the customer to properly execute the transition between

- TRANSITION_METHOD_UNSPECIFIED: Zero value
- TRANSITION_METHOD_SUPPORT: The transition should be done via a support request, the current behaviour for any transition
- TRANSITION_METHOD_WIZARD: The transition should be done via a custom Wizard. Fields which should be
provided will be guided by PlanTransitionRequiredField
- TRANSITION_METHOD_RECREATE: The transition should be done via logging the user out, deleting the current tenant and creating a new one.
planPlanTransitionMethod.title: PlanTransitionMethod.

planPlanTransitionRequiredField.description:
Fields which UI should provide to the backend to properly execute the transition between plans

- TRANSITION_REQUIRED_FIELD_UNSPECIFIED: Zero value
- TRANSITION_REQUIRED_FIELD_PAYMENT_TOKEN: Stripe token after user enters CC info and we submit it to stripe
- TRANSITION_REQUIRED_FIELD_DOMAIN: Domain for team/organization plans which will be used for keycloak realm
- TRANSITION_REQUIRED_FIELD_CONTACTS: Contacts is billing contacts.
planPlanTransitionRequiredField.title: PlanTransitionRequiredField.

planUsagePlanTransitionFlow.description: Details for transition flow. Is used as part of UsagePlanInternal.
planUsagePlanTransitionFlow.title: UsagePlanTransitionFlow.

required_fields.description: Mandatory information to migrate onto this plan.
required_fields.title: Required fields.

requires_manual_approval.description: If true then any migration onto this plan must be approved by the billing department.
requires_manual_approval.title: Manual approval.

rate_limiterLeakyBucketRateLimiter.description:
X-displayName: "Leaky Bucket Rate Limiter"
Leaky-Bucket is the default rate limiter algorithm for F5.
rate_limiterLeakyBucketRateLimiter.title: LeakyBucketRateLimiter.

rate_limiterRateLimitBlockAction.description:
X-displayName: "Rate Limit Block Action"
Action where a user is blocked from making further requests after exceeding rate limit threshold.
rate_limiterRateLimitBlockAction.title: RateLimitBlockAction.

rate_limiterRateLimitPeriodUnit.description:
X-displayName: "Rate Limit Period Unit"
Unit for the period per which the rate limit is applied.

- SECOND: Second

x-displayName: "Seconds"
Rate limit period unit is seconds
- MINUTE: Minute

x-displayName: "Minutes"
Rate limit period unit is minutes
- HOUR: Hour

x-displayName: "Hours"
Rate limit period unit is hours
- DAY: Day

x-displayName: "Days"
Rate limit period unit is days.
rate_limiterRateLimitPeriodUnit.title: RateLimitPeriodUnit.

rate_limiterRateLimitValue.description:
X-displayName: "Rate Limit Value"
A tuple consisting of a rate limit period unit and the total number of allowed requests for that period.
rate_limiterRateLimitValue.title: RateLimitValue.

burst_multiplier.description:
X-displayName: "Burst Multiplier"
The maximum burst of requests to accommodate, expressed as a multiple of the rate.
burst_multiplier.title: Burst_multiplier.

period_multiplier.description:
X-displayName: "Periods"
This setting, combined with Per Period units, provides a duration.
period_multiplier.title: Period_multiplier.

total_number.description:
X-displayName: "Number Of Requests"
x-required
The total number of allowed requests per rate-limiting period.
total_number.title: Total_number.

rate_limiterTokenBucketRateLimiter.description:
X-displayName: "Token Bucket Rate Limiter"
Token-Bucket is a rate limiter algorithm that is stricter with enforcing limits.
rate_limiterTokenBucketRateLimiter.title: TokenBucketRateLimiter.

schemaEmpty.description:
X-displayName: "Empty"
This can be used for messages where no values are needed.
schemaEmpty.title: Empty

schemaPlanType.description: PlanType is the type of billing plan for the customer.
schemaPlanType.title: PlanType

schemaTenantType.description:
TenantType is the type of the customer

UNKNOWN indicates the field not being set
FREEMIUM are customer that don't have their domain
ENTERPRiISE customer have their domain.
schemaTenantType.title: TenantType.

schemaquotaGlobalSpecType.description: GlobalSpecType defines the shape of the object in database as present in Global Controller.
schemaquotaGlobalSpecType.title: GlobalSpecType.

api_limits.description:
API Limits defines ratelimit parameters for an API at the stdlib service
The key of the api_limits map is rpc FQN e.g. "VES.I/o.schema.advertise_policy.api.create"
api_limits.title: Api_limits.

apigw_limits.description:
API Gateway Limits defines rate limit value parameters for an API at a service level (prism, sentinel, etc)
The key of the apigw_limits map is rpc FQN e.g. "VES.I/o.schema.advertise_policy.api.create"
apigw_limits.title: Apigw_limits.

object_limits.description:
Object Limits define maximum number of instances that can be present per object kind for the tenant
The key of the object_limits map is object kind e.g. "virtual_host"
object_limits.title: Object_limits.

resource_limits.description:
Resource Limits define maximum value of resources in the appropriate units that can be present. The key of
the resource limits is the resource name.
resource_limits.title: Resource_limits.
